title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Brigando Red (Lisboa)
description: A totally ready-to-drink wine that is full of bright red fruits and crisp acidity. It has some soft tannins and a dry edge, though the wine just bursts with fruit. Drink now.

title: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2015 Oenodea Malagouzia-Moscato-Sauvignon Blanc White (Drama)
description: This wine has a pronounced nose of flowers and bright tropical fruit, followed by fruit-forward flavors of nectarine and lemon. The wine is a bit showy but a mineral finish gives it poise.

title: Arrogant Frog 2015 Lily Pad White Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)
description: There's a subtle hint of toasted brioche to the ripe peach and baked apple core of this medium-bodied wine. Ample acidity keeps the palate fresh, while accents of citrus rind, peach pit and baking spice carry through to the close.

title: Calcu 2013 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Colchagua Valley)
description: Briary and rubbery smelling, this also shows aromas of leafy herbal plum. Fairly pinched and tannic, this delivers a raw mouthfeel. Skins-based flavors of plum and currant are slightly bitter, while the finish pinches like the palate.

title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Península de Setúbal)
description: Bold and spicy, this is a soft, round wine. It is ripe with berry fruits and crisp with acidity. While it only hints at the structure of Touriga Nacional it does have a rich, warm character that makes it ready to drink now.

title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca White (Douro)
description: Melon and ripe pear flavors give some richness to this lightly citrus flavored wine. With attractive acidity, it is crisp, clean and tangy at the end. Drink now.

title: Castillo de Monséran 2015 Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Bouncy berry and cherry aromas are more or less standard for basic Garnacha. This wine feels a bit gummy and grabby, but not sticky. Lightly herbal, minty dark-berry flavors finish herbal, chocolaty and a touch green.

title: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2014 Tectonia Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Minerally raw aromas brush up against harsh. This is razor sharp, with cutting acidity. Flavors of lemon-lime and tangerine peel lean towards sour due to high acidity. This turns more pickled and briny on the finish.

title: Bodegas Hidalgo 2014 Cuerno  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Most of what this is showing on the nose, palate and finish reflects the patchy ripeness of a tough vintage. Saucy, savory, roasted berry and earth aromas precede a high-acid palate with flavors of tomato, red plum, vanilla and lactic oak. Its dry, jagged finish is wiry and raw.

title: Dutton Estate 2014 Dutton Palms Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A baked lemon, honeyed aspect of this wine makes it seem overripe in many ways, a lush, full-bodied characteristic that seems slightly overdone. From one of the farming family's Green Valley ranches, it's intense and creamy.

title: Earth's Harvest 2013 Merlot (California)
description: This easy-to-drink wine combines a lightly oaky aroma with good but light fruit flavors and savory accents. It's dry and well balanced, with a smooth mouthfeel.

title: Hayes Valley 2014 Zinfandel (Central Coast)
description: A solid wine for the price, this shows lush aromas of baked red cherries, vanilla, caramel and clove. The palate is more restrained with tart, somewhat rigid tannins that will allow more fruit and spice flavors to emerge with patience.

title: Helwig NV Oro De Tolo Verdelho (California)
description: A deep amber color and powerful aromas lead to fruity-nutty flavors, very full body and a nutty, Bourbon-barrel finish. This very assertive, fortified style of wine should taste great after dinner.

title: Henry Fessy 2015  Beaujolais-Villages
description: This merchant house, with labels that carry a classic Frenchman's mustache, has made a soft rounded wine with attractive red-berry fruits. It is juicy and full of acidity that finishes the wine with a crisp aftertaste.

title: Louis Jadot 2015  Beaujolais
description: Light, fruity and juicy, this is a soft cherry-flavored wine. It has attractive acidity that lifts the warm fruitiness and gives the wine its characteristic perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.

title: M. Chapoutier 2015 Les Vignes de Bila-Haut Rosé (Pays d'Oc)
description: This is a pretty and floral rosé, with attractive notes of strawberry, red cherry, sweet pea and white clover. The light-weight palate offers vibrant notes of red currant and lime peel that carry through to the bright and refreshing finish. Drink now.

title: Il Conventino 2014  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Made with 85% Sangiovese and 15% Colorino and Canaiolo—all organically grown—this straightforward red opens with aromas of violet and black cherry. The vibrant, simple palate offers raspberry and a note of white pepper alongside chewy tannins and nervous acidity.

title: Fanti 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Delicate aromas recalling forest floor, aromatic herb and a floral note lead the way. The simple, rather diluted palate offers suggestions of red berry and a sprinkling of clove alongside bright acidity and fleeting tannins.

title: Eximius NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty and smoky upfront, the nose on this brut is a bit sharp-edged, with a hint of applesauce. Lively and fresh in feel, this tastes of lime, apple and quince. A tangy tasting finish slowly fades out.

title: Gérard Bertrand 2015 Gris Blanc Rosé (Pays d'Oc)
description: A pale, almost water-like color in the glass, this is a light and nuanced rosé. Scents of white cherry, melon rind, orange peel and sweet grass unfold in the bouquet and carry through to the light-bodied palate. A tart red-currant flavor and citric vibrancy linger on the close. Drink now.

title: Mersenne 2015 Chesnut Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a light, focused and cleanly refreshing white, stainless-steel fermented and aged to retain zesty acidity and lingering traces of lemon and lime. It finishes with tartness on the palate.

title: Kunde 2013 Estate Grown Dunfillan Cuvee Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: This blends 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 45% Syrah from estate-farmed vineyards, the result a mix of cured meat, charred oak and rich, dark cherry. Full bodied and concentrated, it offers structure amid the ripeness.

title: One Leaf 2013 Pinot Noir (California)
description: The flavors of this full-bodied wine are ripe and the texture soft, so it gives a feeling of being broad and relaxed on the palate. Aromas recall cola and dark berries, and the flavors resemble stewed cherries.

title: Peachy Canyon 2014 Incredible Red Zinfandel (California)
description: Dried black cherries, vanilla and a touch of roasted meat show on the rich, luscious and fruity nose of this bargain bottling. The palate is juicy with black cherry and milk-chocolate flavors that lean a little bit sweet.

title: Solar de Cambres 2011 Casa de Cambres Reserva Red (Douro)
description: The wine is dry, and firm with tannins still masking the fruit. With its dark coffee flavor it has been heavily extracted and this needs to soften before the wine will be ready. Look for the berry fruits and acidity as the wine ages. Drink from 2017.

title: Vignobles Fontan 2015 Domaine de Maubet Gros Manseng (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: A medium dry wine with hints of honey over dried apricot and lemon crispness. Intense acidity gives the wine great lift and crispness. It is still young and will be better from 2017.

title: River Road 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Light and clear in color this wine is somewhat simple on the palate and marked by the presence of oak. Light bodied, it has flavors of baked bread and strawberry jam that get along well before a wave of vanilla lingers on the finish.

title: Koenig 2015 Riesling (Alsace)
description: Hints of orange and lemon on the rather muddied nose of this wine lead to a palate characterized by ripened fruit. While the palate is slightly dilute it shows freshness and a dry finish.

title: Bunnell 2011 Souzao (Snipes Mountain)
description: This variety is still a rarity in the state. Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of vanilla and coffee followed by herbs. The flavors are elegant, with a tart lick of acidity, but bring a stewed element that distracts.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Ciconia Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: This is an open, ripe and accessible wine. With soft tannins and ripe Aragonez and Syrah fruit, it is drinkable now. Berries and acidity complete this fruity wine.
